Is it possible to improve the hashing for links in same portchannel? Otherwise, for dualtor topology, the traffic from standby tor to active tor would be un-balanced in links of same portchannel.

> Is it possible to improve the hashing for links in same portchannel? Otherwise, for dualtor topology, the traffic from standby tor to active tor would be un-balanced in links of same portchannel.

If the two interfaces of the port-channel use different MACs, that could get a different hash. But it is a global teamd configuration,  I can't say how much it will impact.  Currently, the traffic already does ECMP between two tors, and also load-balanced between the different port channels. As the tunnel traffic path is from standby tor to active tor, the bandwidth should be enough even just use one link.

comments.body: can you add reason why skip?

> can you add reason why skip?

The CRM resources in Mellanox seem to be shared. The test creates NHOP groups as advertised (up to a max of 1024). On Mellanox even after creating all the NHOP groups, NHOP resources are not '0'. 

The primary purpose of this test is to make sure SONiC doesn't crash when NHOP groups beyond the advertised number is created. That check is not skipped.

Added the reason in the code as a comment.

The code looks good to me, but I have one concern, that is we may call open-flow CLI to modify bridge in multi-process now. I'm not sure if it's supported. There is no doc for that.

> The code looks good to me, but I have one concern, that is we may call open-flow CLI to modify bridge in multi-process now. I'm not sure if it's supported. There is no doc for that.

Yes, multi-process may call the `ovs-ofctl` command at the same time. I tested starting two shell scripts continuously run the `ovs-ofctl dump-flows` commands. No conflict was observed. I'll perform more tests with `ovs-ofctl mod-flow/add-flow/del-flow` to further confirm.

Just tested concurrent `ovs-ofctl mod-flow/add-flow/del-flow` on different bridges, no conflicts were observed. Different mux simulator instance won't work on same set of bridges, so we don't have to worry about conflicts of updating same bridge.

This behavior change is a little risky, I think. Since we may run ```ansible-playbook``` to do some job, say deploying a testbed, and at the same time we may use ```run_test.sh``` to debug some test case. Then the deploy job will be killed unexpectedly. I think users should be responsible to do the cleanup job after running test manually. How do you think?

> This behavior change is a little risky, I think. Since we may run `ansible-playbook` to do some job, say deploying a testbed, and at the same time we may use `run_test.sh` to debug some test case. Then the deploy job will be killed unexpectedly. I think users should be responsible to do the cleanup job after running test manually. How do you think?

The run_tests.sh tool is mainly used for nightly test. In this case, it does not need to worry about deploy jobs running at the same time. This change is to workaround the possible issue that the pytest process is not terminate properly. Then the run_tests.sh would fail and do not have a chance to do cleanup.

I think purpose of such kind of change is similar to "restart-ptf", to prepare a clean environment for nightly tests.

HI @yxieca @lguohan @AshokDaparthi @neethajohn 
To which branch will the feature be merged?
I just realized the sonic-mgmt change can affect all the existing branches without this feature.
After the PR is merged, sonic-mgmt will assume the format of qos/buffer references to be `[<field-name>]`, like `ingress_lossless_pool`.
However, in the branches without this feature, the qos/buffer references are still in the old format, like `[BUFFER_POOL|ingress_lossless_pool]`. This will fail the qos test in old branches.
I think there are two ways to handle this
- Fork a dedicated branch of sonic-mgmt for older branches
- Handle the format of qos/buffer references per version.
  - in older branches, like 202012, the format should be `[<table-name>|<field-name>]`
  - in the latest branch, the format should be `<field-name>`.
